sn1.14:1: v.26"The khattiya is the best of bipeds,The ox, the best of quadrupeds;A maiden is the best of wives,The first born, the best of sons."[n.23] From this point on, wherever the text does not specify the identity of the speakers, it is implied that the first verse is spoken by a devata and the reply by the Buddha.
sn1.14:2: v.7"The Buddha is the best of bipeds,A steed, the best of quadrupeds;An obedient woman is the best of wives,A dutiful boy, the best of sons."sn.i.7
